text.p: The Budapest Stock Exchange suspended trading in the shares of textile industrial company Pannon-Flax on Wednesday following an over-rapid intraday rise after the release its 1996 results, traders said.
Pannon-Flax shares opened at 570 forints and rallied 20 percent to a year-high of 660 forints, triggering its suspension about a quarter hour before spot trading closes, they said.
Styl was suspended at 0958 GMT at 1,450 forints, having surged 20.58 percent since its last closing price of 1,200 forints on June 25.
Until that time three deals were made for a total of 275 shares.
A stock exchange official in the floor confirmed the suspension to Reuters.
"It was suspended for too rapid rise," she said.
The stock exchange decides to suspend trading for a day in any stock if its price movements exceed 20 percent in either direction.
